languages.name: C programming
languages.definition: C is a general-purpose, procedural programming language.
languages.why_learn: C is the foundation of many other programming languages and is widely used in system programming, embedded systems, and low-level programming.
languages.working_field: Software development, systems programming, embedded systems, firmware development, operating systems, etc.
best_books: The C Programming Language by Brian W. Kernighan and Dennis M. Ritchie
C Programming Absolute Beginner's Guide by Perry and Miller
C Programming for the Absolute Beginner by Vine
Head First C by Griffiths and Griffiths
Learn C the Hard Way by Shaw
C Programming: A Modern Approach by King

languages.name: C++
languages.definition: C++ is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language.
languages.why_learn: C++ extends C and adds support for object-oriented programming, making it suitable for a wide range of applications.
languages.working_field: Software development, game development, systems programming, high-performance applications, etc.
best_books: The C++ Programming Language by Bjarne Stroustrup
C++ Primer by Stanley B. Lippman, Jos√©e Lajoie, and Barbara E. Moo
Effective C++ by Scott Meyers
Accelerated C++ by Andrew Koenig and Barbara E. Moo
Programming: Principles and Practice Using C++ by Bjarne Stroustrup
C++ Concurrency in Action by Anthony Williams

languages.name: Java
languages.definition: Java is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language.
languages.why_learn: Java is platform-independent, has a large ecosystem, and is widely used in enterprise applications and Android app development.
languages.working_field: Software development, Android app development, web development, enterprise applications, etc.
best_books: Effective Java by Joshua Bloch
Java: The Complete Reference by Herbert Schildt
Head First Java by Kathy Sierra and Bert Bates
Thinking in Java by Bruce Eckel
Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship by Robert C. Martin
Java Concurrency in Practice by Brian Goetz, Tim Peierls, Joshua Bloch, Joseph Bowbeer, David Holmes, and Doug Lea

languages.name: Python
languages.definition: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language.
languages.why_learn: Python is easy to learn, versatile, and has a large community, making it ideal for web development, data analysis, AI, and scripting.
languages.working_field: Web development, data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, automation, etc.
best_books: Python Crash Course by Eric Matthes
Automate the Boring Stuff with Python by Al Sweigart
Learning Python by Mark Lutz
Python Cookbook by David Beazley and Brian K. Jones
Fluent Python by Luciano Ramalho
Effective Python by Brett Slatkin

languages.name: JavaScript
languages.definition: JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language.
languages.why_learn: JavaScript is the language of the web, used for front-end and back-end development, making it essential for web developers.
languages.working_field: Web development, front-end development, back-end development, mobile app development, etc.
best_books: Eloquent JavaScript by Marijn Haverbeke
JavaScript: The Good Parts by Douglas Crockford
You Don't Know JS by Kyle Simpson
JavaScript: The Definitive Guide by David Flanagan
JavaScript: The Weird Parts by Anthony Alicea
Learning JavaScript Design Patterns by Addy Osmani

languages.name: PHP
languages.definition: PHP is a server-side, scripting programming language.
languages.why_learn: PHP is widely used for web development and powers many popular websites and content management systems.
languages.working_field: Web development, server-side development, content management systems, e-commerce platforms, etc.
best_books: PHP for the Web by Larry Ullman
Modern PHP: New Features and Good Practices by Josh Lockhart
PHP and MySQL Web Development by Luke Welling and Laura Thomson
Learning PHP, MySQL & JavaScript by Robin Nixon
PHP Objects, Patterns, and Practice by Matt Zandstra
Pro PHP Refactoring by Francesco Trucchia and Jacopo Romei

languages.name: Kotlin
languages.definition: Kotlin is a modern, statically typed programming language.
languages.why_learn: Kotlin is designed to be fully interoperable with Java, making it a popular choice for Android app development.
languages.working_field: Android app development, server-side development, web development, etc.
best_books: Kotlin in Action by Dmitry Jemerov and Svetlana Isakova
Programming Kotlin by Stephen Samuel and Stefan Bocutiu
Head First Kotlin by Dawn Griffiths and David Griffiths
Kotlin for Android Developers by Antonio Leiva
Modern Web Development with Kotlin by Denis Kalinin
Kotlin for Enterprise Applications by Petre Kozelj and Igor Kucherenko
